dialogue.text: Oh, Sensei. What’s up?
Not doing anything tonight?
Nope. Just thought I’d say hi since you’re sitting here on the floor for some reason.
Just getting some fresh air. It’s kind of stuffy in the room at the moment.
I don’t know if I’d call the air in the dorm “fresh” but you do you.
Well, what else am I supposed to do? Go outside? It’s freezing out there.
Let me borrow your jacket and I’ll go outside. You can hang out here and watch movies in my bed or something.
We’ll just swap places for a little bit. Does that work for you?
I like my jacket and don’t particularly like movies, so no.
What kind of psychopath doesn’t like movies? What could possibly be the reasoning behind that?
I don’t know. Staying in one place for too long is just boring.
Tell that to the weird bird on top of our vending machine. It hasn't moved since I got here.
I could have sworn it was actually dead but I tried poking it the other day and I’m pretty sure it threatened to kill me.
It didn’t...pull a knife out on you, did it?
Uhh...no. It’s still just a bird after all. It wouldn’t be able to do something like that.
Oh, Io...You sweet, summer child.
What?...What did I do?
You will learn the true nature of that animal in time. For now, it may be best if you remain oblivious.
Oh...Uhh, okay.
I still don’t really get it, but you got this really serious look as soon as I brought the bird up, so I’ll listen to you.
Good.
So anyway, how are things going over here? Hate being around the other girls as much as you expected to?
If you mean the dorms in general and not[school], not really.
I don’t have to talk to anybody over here.
Even when I’m just sitting in the hall, no one other than Uta really makes an effort to talk to me. So that’s cool.
No, that’s just depressing. I figured they’d at least try.
Ehh. Who knows? Maybe they have and I just haven’t noticed?
Either way, not really something I want to spend too much time thinking about.
The dorm itself is really cool.
Even though Uta takes up like 75%% of the room, it’s still cool having a place I can sort of turn into my own little thing.
Don’t you have a room at the bathhouse?
I do, but it’s really just my aunt’s guest room that I wound up moving into and I feel kinda bad about sprucing it up. You know?
The dorm has a surprisingly small list of rules we need to adhere to, so once I found out I could do whatever I wanted, it made me a lot more comfortable.
Only downside is that the showers here don’t get nearly hot enough so I still have to use the ones at work.
Your life is so hard.
Also, why does our class get its own building?
Where even is the other dorm?
You’re asking me a bunch of questions I do not have the answer to right now.
You didn’t learn all this stuff when you became a teacher?
Maybe it’s some sort of conspiracy or something?
Oh man! Great idea!
Sensei, let’s start a revolution!
...What?
What are we revolting against?
[kumon_mi_high]. We can secede and declare this dorm a republic. Then we won’t have to go to[school] at all and can just hang out here every day.
You know, maybe this does call for a revolution after all?
The dorm functioning as an independent entity sounds quite enticing.
Who even needs college?
What’s the point of going into debt just so you can try out for a slightly better job in order to pay off all of it?
More people should just learn tradeskills.
Sure, a lot of them are less {i}glamorous{/i}, but they’re literally {i}always{/i} needed and there are tons of programs much cheaper than colleges.
Why are you in college then?
Because I'm a hypocrite. Duh.
Oh, right.
I get that I haven’t shown a lot of interest in class yet, but I have no intention of leaving. Especially with you as my teacher.
I had a feeling my methods would reach you.
Well your feeling was spot-on.
It’s cool waking up and not dreading whatever is going to happen for the rest of the day immediately.
It just sucks that I only have several months of that until it all goes away and I have to find my place in yet {i}another{/i} group of students.
Just get held back and stay in my class.
Or do nothing at all and achieve the exact same result.
Heheh~ Gonna miss me when I’m gone?
Maybe I {i}will{/i} get held back and then run for class-rep next year so I can spend even more time with you.
That sounds great as long as you can figure out how to communicate with others as well.
For the last time, I’m actually pretty good at that. I can do it if I want to.
Right. You just don’t {i}want{/i} to.
Precisely. So stop trying to get me to. Got it?
Yeah, yeah. I won’t make you do anything you don’t want to.
Good. Only someone horrible would force someone into doing something they’re not comfortable with.
Io and I talk for a little while longer before she decides she wants to go back into her room and head to sleep early.
Not having anything else to do and feeling a bit guilty about knocking on someone else’s door at this hour of the night, I decide to head home and go to sleep as well.
I have to go to work tomorrow, so crashing early will be advantageous in the long run.
I make my way down the steps of the dorm and into the cold once more, ready for the harsh winds of yet another winter night.
...Or at least that’s what I think until the wind actually hits my skin.
From that point on, it’s absolute Hell the whole way back.
I wasn't ready at all.
{i}Io’s affection has increased to [io_love]!{/i}
